newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: ESR recommends Portugal's Colep as buy.
newsitem.headline: ESR recommends Portugal's Colep as buy.

text.p: Espirito Santo Research (ESR) said it recommended the purchase of shares of metal packaging business Colep Portugal, revising upwards its estimates for profits to one billion escudos ($5.4 million) in 1997 and two billion in 1998.
"Given the development of sales above expectations and a capital increase, we have revised our estimates for 1997 and 1998 upwards," said an update of ESR.

"We forecast an average growth in sales of 12.5 percent in the next two years, reaching an operating margin of 18.8 percent in 1998. The net profit is expected to stand at one billion escudos this year and to double that level in 1998," it said.
Previously EDP had estimated that Colep would post a 1997 net profit of 928 million escudos in 1997.
Separately, Colep Portugal's managing director Jorge Ribeiro said he expected the company to post a net profit of between 900 million escudos and one billion escudos for 1997.

"We are maintaining our previous forecasts for sales of 15.8 billion escudos. In terms of profits, we still believe that they will be between 900 million and one billion escudos," he told Reuters. ($ = 185.3 Portugese Escudos)
